name: 905.z5

messages.content:
The phone rings.

Oh, no - how long have you been asleep? Sure, it was a tough night, but... This is bad. This is very bad.

The phone rings.

  -----
9:05 by Adam Cadre
v1.12 (2016.0430) / Original release 2000.0103
  -----

Bedroom (in bed)
This bedroom is extremely spare, with dirty laundry scattered haphazardly all over the floor. Cleaner clothing can be found in the dresser. A bathroom lies to the south, while a door to the east leads to the living room.

On the end table are a telephone, a wallet and some keys.

The phone rings.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I'm in a disheveled bedroom, the phone is ringing insistently, and I'm feeling groggy and disoriented.  
THOUGHT: I need to answer that phone before it stops ringing, or I might miss something important.  
COMMAND: Answer phone.

messages.content:
You pick up the phone. "Hadley!" a shrill voice cries. "Hadley, haven't you even left yet?? You knew that our presentation was at nine o'clock sharp! First the thing with the printers, now this - there won't even be enough left of you for Bowman to fire once he's done with you. Now get the hell down here!!"

Click.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I've just woken up to a frantic call about a missed presentation, and now I'm feeling the pressure to get moving.  
THOUGHT: I need to get dressed and gather my things quickly if I want to salvage this situation.  
COMMAND: Get dressed.

messages.content:
[!: Noun error. (This could mean a number of things: a noun used in your command may not be present, or it may be present but not visible; it may be scenery you can't interact with; you may have specified too many indirect objects; you may have misspelled something; the list goes on.)]

>

SITUATION: I'm still in bed, realizing the urgency of my situation but struggling to interact with my surroundings.  
THOUGHT: Perhaps I should just get out of bed and start moving instead of trying to dress first.  
COMMAND: Get out.

messages.content:
You get out of bed.

Bedroom
This bedroom is extremely spare, with dirty laundry scattered haphazardly all over the floor. Cleaner clothing can be found in the dresser. A bathroom lies to the south, while a door to the east leads to the living room.

On the end table are a telephone, a wallet and some keys.

>

THOUGHT: I should grab some clean clothes from the dresser and my essentials from the end table before dashing out.  
COMMAND: Check dresser.

COMMAND: Take wallet.

SITUATION: I've taken my wallet from the end table, but I still need my keys before I can leave.

COMMAND: Take keys.

SITUATION: I've successfully taken my keys, along with my wallet, and I'm now ready to leave the bedroom.  
THOUGHT: I need to get to the living room and out the door as quickly as possible to make it to the presentation.  
COMMAND: Go east.

messages.content:
Living room
The furniture isn't as carefully arranged as one might like, and it's a bit lacking in the luxuries that might make this a more pleasant place to spend an evening - no stereo, no TV, no DVD, none of that - but this living room is still nicer than most of those in this neighborhood. A kitchenette lies to the east, the bedroom to the west and the front door to the south.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I'm now in the living room, which is modest and lacks entertainment but still an improvement over the bedroom. I can head to the kitchenette or exit through the front door.  
THOUGHT: I need to get out of here as quickly as possible—no time for distractions.  
COMMAND: Go south.

SITUATION: The front door is closed, creating a barrier between me and my escape to the outside world.  
THOUGHT: I need to open the door and get moving before I miss the presentation entirely.  
COMMAND: Open door.

messages.content:
[Which do you mean, the bedroom door or the front door?]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game is asking for clarification on which door I want to open, but I am focused on the front door to leave the house.  
THOUGHT: I must clarify that I want to open the front door to get outside quickly.  
COMMAND: Open front door.

SITUATION: The front door is now open, providing me access to the outside world and a chance to rush to my presentation.  
THOUGHT: I need to move quickly to avoid further delay; every second counts!  
COMMAND: Go outside.

messages.content:
You need to clear out quickly, true, but you look like an absolute wreck - going out in this condition and drawing the inevitable bewildered stares would just be making a bad situation worse.

>
